|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-TNC |rad1txchains = 4 |rad1rxchains = 4 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |acqam1 = |rad1ac = 1300 |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Marvell;88W8764; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-TNC |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *AIR-CAP3702(E/I)-(D/N/Z)-K9, AIR-SAP3702(E/I)-(D/N/Z)-K9 :This FCC ID would appear to cover most of the 3702 APs. This particular one is an external antenna model (3702'''E''' vs 3702'''I'''). Stated covered models in the FCC test report are... Used OUIs may include 00:22:BD (on module MAC label) and 44:D3:CA (on EUT back). 88W8764C ''may possibly'' be the P/N of the b/g/n radio. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ===Bootlog=== {{SCollapse|boot log • >> |
